intro: Hedeoma diffusa, commonly known as Mexican mint marigold, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and aromatic foliage. The plant produces small, yellow to orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, lance-shaped, and emit a strong, mint-like scent when crushed. Hedeoma diffusa is often used in traditional medicine and as a culinary herb due to its pungent aroma and medicinal properties.
